cards.english: I drive a lorry from **Nairobi to Mombasa** * **
cards.kikuyu: Ndwairithagia rorĩ kuma Nairobi kinya Mombasa**
cards.context: Verb conjugation - Other - Verb conjugation: conjugation example - File 492
cards.cultural_notes: Native speaker verb conjugation from Easy Kikuyu lessons by Emmanuel Kariuki. Native speaker verb conjugation examples from Easy Kikuyu lessons This example demonstrates other conjugation patterns in natural Kikuyu speech, showing authentic usage and proper morphological structure.

cards.kikuyu: Ndingĩendana na mũKenya** - **I cannot fall in love wit a Kenyan** * **Matĩũĩ kwendana** - **They do not know how to love** * **Mendana hanini** - **they have loved (each other) a little** **(A faded watermark diagonally across the top reads: "Learn Kikuyu

cards.cultural_notes: Native speaker verb conjugation from Easy Kikuyu lessons by Emmanuel Kariuki. Native speaker verb conjugation examples from Easy Kikuyu lessons This example demonstrates other conjugation patterns in natural Kikuyu speech, showing authentic usage and proper morphological structure.

cards.english: I have not opened Nīngūhingūrīte kabere -I opened earlier Nī wethamba?- Have you taken bath? Ndinethamba-I have not taken a bath Nīngwīthambīte kabere-I took a bath earlier. Nīūrugire cai? -Have you made tea? Ndinaruga cai.-I have not made tea. Nīndugire cai hau kabere-I made tea earlier .  -----------
